republican.round_0: I disagree. If we acknowledge that some people may hold biases without malicious intent, we're essentially excusing racism. The fact remains, racist policies and actions have real-world consequences for African Americans and other minorities. We can't separate the two; one must lead to the other.
republican.round_1: "I agree with Sam that addressing individual biases requires looking at the systems and structures that enable them. We can't just 'grow out of' racist attitudes; we must confront and dismantle them."
republican.round_2: "I think the key is to focus on education and personal growth, rather than simply excusing or shaming individuals for their biases.
